title: Trust as Infrastructure
content:
üèîÔ∏è "The real infrastructure in Greenland is trust. Not the roads."

Edvard Lybert M√∏rk from Nalek Ventures shared this powerful insight at Nordic Circular Summit 2025 in Nuuk.

In the Arctic, where distances are vast and conditions are extreme, social infrastructure matters more than physical infrastructure.

This principle applies to circular economy everywhere: we need pre-competitive collaboration frameworks where competitors trust each other enough to work on shared challenges.

üîπ Denmark's Circular Furniture Network: 30 competing brands collaborating
üîπ Voluntary Sector Collaboration on Textiles
üîπ Nordic Circular Investments (Finland, Sweden, Norway)

Trust enables the transition. Without it, circular economy stays theoretical.

What role does trust play in your circular transition work?
speaker: Edvard Lybert M√∏rk
media_suggestion: Photo of Arctic landscape or Nuuk cityscape

title: Youth Demands System Change
content:
üíö "Invite us into the room, support us on the streets, and don't jail us."

Keira Dignan from Regeneration 2030 delivered three clear demands from the next generation at #NordicCircularSummit.

She outlined three levels of circular economy:

1Ô∏è‚É£ MICRO LEVEL: Individual choices and company practices
2Ô∏è‚É£ ECONOMY-WIDE: Measuring circularity (currently ~4% globally)
3Ô∏è‚É£ SYSTEM LEVEL: Redesigning economic incentives and decision structures

"What I would like us to push is the SYSTEM level. How is our economy designed? Who gets to make the decisions?"

Youth organizations across the Nordics are working both:
‚Üí INSIDE: Advisory boards to Prime Ministers (Generation 2030 Finland)
‚Üí OUTSIDE: Direct action and activism (NaturUngdom Norway)

This generation isn't asking for a seat at the kids' table. They're demanding structural change in how economic decisions are made.

Are you ready to invite them into the decision-making rooms?

#YouthVoice #SystemChange #CircularEconomy #Regeneration2030 #ClimateAction
speaker: Keira Dignan
media_suggestion: Quote card with Keira's photo and quote

title: Circular Frontiers Session Recap
content:
üåç Day 1 Highlights from Nordic Circular Summit 2025 in Nuuk, Greenland

The opening session "Circular Frontiers: Shaping Our Future" brought together 13 speakers from across the Arctic and Nordic region.

Key Takeaways:

üîµ MEASUREMENT MATTERS
"Circular Economy goes on kilos, not krona or dollars" ‚Äî Einar Kleppe Holthe
We need to measure material flows, not just financial metrics.

üîµ SYMBIOSIS IS OUR SUPERPOWER
Cathrine Barth: "How do we organize for industrial and regional symbiosis? This is our unfair advantage."

üîµ ADAPTABLE > SCALABLE
Edvard M√∏rk: "We understand 'scalable models' as 'adaptable models'" ‚Äî context matters in Arctic conditions.

üîµ INVESTMENT GAP
Alisa Mick: "Circular investments need hybrid public-private models to lower perceived risk."

üîµ POLITICAL ALIGNMENT
Michel Bajuk: "National politics must align with EU circular targets. We have ambition on paper, not in practice."

üîµ TRADITIONAL KNOWLEDGE
Minister Peter Borg: "Nothing is wasted, every part of the catch has a purpose" ‚Äî Greenlandic tradition informs modern circular practices.

This is the 6th Nordic Circular Summit since 2020 ‚Äî and the first held in a self-governing Nordic territory.

Next stop: Faroe Islands üá´üá¥

#CircularEconomy #NordicCircularSummit #Greenland #Sustainability #Arctic #Nuuk

title: Unlearning 250 Years
content:
"We live in a 250-year-old linear economy. The fish don't know what water is."

‚Äî Cathrine Barth at #NordicCircularSummit

My generation needs to UNLEARN what we grew up in.

#CircularEconomy #Sustainability
speaker: Cathrine Barth

title: Circular Economy Stats
content:
üìä The global economy is only ~4% circular.

We need to work on all three levels:

1Ô∏è‚É£ Micro: Individual & company choices
2Ô∏è‚É£ Economy-wide: Increase that 4%
3Ô∏è‚É£ System: Redesign economic incentives

‚Äî Keira Dignan, Regeneration 2030

#CircularEconomy #NordicCircularSummit

title: Session 1 Behind the Scenes
content:
üé¨ Behind the scenes from our opening session in Nuuk!

The Nordic Circular Summit 2025 started with a traditional Greenlandic cultural ceremony by NAPA ‚Äî drum song and lamp lighting that connected us to the land and its values.

"It awakens my spiritual partner inside me, my companion, the polar bear" ‚Äî Minister Peter Borg

This wasn't just a ceremonial opening. It set the tone for everything that followed:

üåä Traditional knowledge meets modern innovation
ü§ù Trust as the real infrastructure
üîÑ Nothing wasted, every part has purpose

When we talk about circular economy in the Arctic, we're not inventing new concepts ‚Äî we're learning from thousands of years of sustainable practice.

üìç Nuuk, Greenland
üóìÔ∏è November 19, 2025
üé§ 13 speakers, 75 minutes, infinite insights

Thank you to everyone who joined us in person and online! üôè

#NordicCircularSummit #Nuuk #Greenland #Arctic #CircularEconomy #TraditionalKnowledge #IndigenousWisdom #Sustainability #NAPA #BehindTheScenes

title: Symbiosis: The Nordic Superpower
content:
üåø SYMBIOSIS: The Nordic Superpower

Cathrine Barth from Natural State Norway dropped this gem:

"Symbiosis is our Nordic superpower. It's how nature works ‚Äî we don't have waste in nature. How do we organize our industries and societies for industrial symbiosis and regional symbiosis?"

What does symbiosis look like in practice?

üîπ DENMARK: 30 competing furniture brands collaborating in the Circular Furniture Network

üîπ TEXTILES: Voluntary sector collaboration where competitors share solutions

üîπ INVESTMENTS: Finland, Sweden, Norway working together on Nordic Circular Investments

üîπ BALTIC-NORDIC: Expanding collaboration to include Estonia, Latvia, Lithuania

This is pre-competitive collaboration ‚Äî where businesses realize that some challenges are too big to solve alone.

Competition on execution.
Collaboration on transformation.

That's the Nordic model for circular transition.

What would symbiosis look like in your industry?

#Symbiosis #CircularEconomy #NordicModel #Collaboration #IndustrialSymbiosis #NordicCircularSummit #Sustainability #Innovation
speaker: Cathrine Barth
media_suggestion: Nature imagery showing symbiosis + business collaboration photos

title: Nordic Circular Summit Day 1 Highlights
content:
üåç What an incredible opening day at Nordic Circular Summit 2025 in Nuuk, Greenland!

We brought together Arctic and Nordic leaders, youth activists, policymakers, and business innovators for "Circular Frontiers: Shaping Our Future."

Top Moments from Session 1:

üíé "Circular Economy goes on kilos, not krona or dollars" ‚Äî We need to measure material flows, not just financial metrics (Einar Kleppe Holthe)

ü§ù "The real infrastructure in Greenland is trust" ‚Äî Social infrastructure matters more than roads in the Arctic (Edvard M√∏rk)

üå± "Invite us into the room, support us on the streets, and don't jail us" ‚Äî Youth demanding system-level change (Keira Dignan, Regeneration 2030)

üîÑ "Symbiosis is our Nordic superpower" ‚Äî Learning from nature to organize our industries (Cathrine Barth)

üèîÔ∏è "Nothing is wasted, every part has a purpose" ‚Äî Traditional Greenlandic knowledge informing modern circular practices (Minister Peter Borg)

This was our 6th summit since 2020 and the first ever held in a self-governing Nordic territory.

Thank you to everyone who joined us in Nuuk and online! Tomorrow we continue with sessions on circular ocean economy, materials governance, and local resilience.

üì• Download the full transcript, article, and key quotes at: nordiccircularsummit.com/transcripts

#NordicCircularSummit #CircularEconomy #Greenland #Nuuk #Sustainability #Arctic #ClimateAction

title: The Investment Paradox
content:
üí∞ THE CIRCULAR INVESTMENT PARADOX

Why do investors see circular economy as "too risky"?

Alisa Mick from Mixi Finland addressed this head-on at Nordic Circular Summit:

"For many years, circular economy has been seen as something that is not so investable. Circular investments are seen as more risky because they require more time."

The structural challenge:

üè≠ Physical infrastructure needed (factories, logistics)
üìö Market education required
ü§ù Multi-stakeholder networks take time to build
‚è∞ Longer timelines than software solutions

Compare:
‚Üí Tech startup: Scale fast with code
‚Üí Circular startup: Build physical systems, educate markets, coordinate supply chains

The solution isn't to make circular businesses "faster."

It's to change our investment models.

"We need NEW TYPES OF INVESTMENT MODELS which bring public investments and private investments together so that we can lower the risk that private investors are currently seeing."

‚Äî Alisa Mick

Examples emerging:
üîπ Nordic Circular Investments (Finland, Sweden, Norway)
üîπ Hybrid public-private funding structures
üîπ De-risking mechanisms for circular infrastructure

The question isn't whether circular economy is investable.

It's whether our investment frameworks are fit for purpose.

Are you rethinking your investment thesis for circular transitions?

#CircularEconomy #Investment #Innovation #Sustainability #NordicCircularSummit #ClimateFinance #ImpactInvesting
speaker: Alisa Mick
